etymology.description: semantic 車 (“vehicle; cart”) + phonetic 未 (wèi).
etymology.interpretation: The vehicle/carriage element 車 signals an association with wheels and axles. 未 provides the sound wèi and helps distinguish this specific part, referring to the tip or end of an axle. Together they denote the axle end or cap in cart/vehicle construction.

examples.chinese: 我们更换了损坏的軎(我們更換了損壞的軎)。
examples.english: We replaced the damaged axle tip.

examples.chinese: 机械师检查轮轴的軎(機械師檢查輪軸的軎)，确保行车安全(確保行車安全)。
examples.pinyin: Jīxièshī jiǎnchá lúnzhóu de wèi, quèbǎo xíngchē ānquán.
examples.english: The mechanic inspects the axle end to ensure driving safety.

examples.chinese: 古代车辆用木楔固定軎(古代車輛用木楔固定軎)。
examples.pinyin: Gǔdài chēliàng yòng mùxiē gùdìng wèi.
examples.english: Ancient vehicles used wooden wedges to secure the axle tip.
